p:
Thiopurines reduce the number and function of activated T cells
32 and have been associated with an increased risk for viral infections.
80 To date, there is insufficient evidence to conclude that thiopurines might actually increase the risk of SARS-CoV-2 infection. Because they still continue to exert their immunosuppressive effect for weeks after cessation,
81 dose reduction and therapy discontinuation are not currently recommended.
